info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 10:22AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...An intense lake effect snow band will affect northeastern Geauga...northeastern Lake...southern Ashtabula and southwestern Crawford Counties Until 1145 AM EST.... At 1021 AM EST, radar indicated an intense lake effect snow band along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Fairport Harbor to 7 miles northwest of Andover, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARDS INCLUDE... Visibility rapidly dropping to less than a quarter of a mile... Up to 2 inches of quick snow accumulation... Locations impacted include... Painesville, Fairport Harbor, Geneva, Madison, Perry, Andover, Adamsville, Pymatuning Central, Atlantic, Austinburg, Roaming Shores, Cherry Valley, North Perry, Thompson, Jamestown, Rock Creek, Grand River, North Madison, and Hartstown. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this snow band passes your location. && ODOT DMS 332.
